result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha A Hentges was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

miscConds.notes:
Joint & several with co-defendants.

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the agent but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

DOC 31
PO Lauren Kummer

10:16 am Def appears by phone, Atty Joseph Geraldson for atty. ADA John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Restitution, including 10% surcharge: $2649.82
Sentence:  WITHHOLD SENTENCE, PROBATION FOR 1 YEAR, CONDITIONS:  REQUIRED TO PAY $2399.84 FOR RESTITUTION IN PAYMENTS AND 10% SURCHARGE FOR A TOTAL OF $2649.82 JOINT AND SEVERAL WITH ANY OTHER CO-DEFENDANTS  AND 30 HOURS OF COMMUNITY SERVICE WORK. MANDATORY COURT COSTS AND FEES $443.00 SHE IS INDIGENT AND COURT WILL WAIVE 50% OF THE OBLIGATIONS, COURTS OFFICE WILL ALLOCATE THE REMAINING AMOUNT.
SIGN UP FOR PROBATION WITHIN 72 HOURS AND PROVIDE A DNA SAMPLE WITHIN THE SAME TIME FRAME.

No appearance by Def - Atty Joseph Geraldson present.  Courtney Kay Strittmater appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
GERALDSON: last hearing we had her car was broken and she couldn't make it. I talked to her yesterday, she has the same issue. She can appear by phone at a new date. I am asking to allow her to be by phone. STRITTMATER: it's probation if rest paid up front. GERALDSON: $2400.00 in rest and she can't pay that. DOC doesn't want her on probation. CRT: you can make the argument but I won't delay it. 
SEH: Andrea to schedule  - Def can appear by phone

No appearance by Def - Atty Joseph Geraldson present.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
GERALDSON: she called yesterday and told me her car broke down and she didn't have a way to get here. This has been con't for her to pay rest. She paid $100.00 and due is $2749.82 - including the surcharge
Sentencing hearing on August 17, 2017 at 09:45 am.

10:21 AM - No appearance by Def - Atty Joseph Geraldson present.  Susan C Donskey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
GERALDSON: I called her a half hr ago but she's not here. CRT: We'll see if she makes it.  But I don't know if I'll have time to do it and we don't have any time the rest of the week. 10:42 AM - case recalled - def now present
CRT; sentencing has been con't for pymt of rest. Crt set a benchmark of $300.00 and she has $200.00 to pay today. STATE: no objection to setting this over for  60 days for pymt of rest. CRT: I won't con't this indefinitely but you are starting work this week. 
SENTENCING: 90 days

10:15 AM - No appearance by Def - Atty Joseph Geraldson present.  Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
GERALDSON: this was reset about 3 wks ago. She was in Houston Cty CJ and she called me and was just released on Sunday.  I just need a new court date so she can be here. She wasn't aware of this court date
